addons.name: Hide Navigation Bar
addons.description:
This extension enables you to hide the navigation bar through a toggle button. Currently the toggle button is the F2 key. You can change the key in the extensions options, as well as configure whether you want the Navigation Bar to be displayed on an initial Firefox launch. Also allows you to enable an Auto-Hide mode if you wish to use that instead.

This extension is based off the work completed in the Hide Menu Bar extension.

addons.name: Hide Tabbar
addons.description: Hide the tabbar by just pressing a key.
addons.fullDescription:
Don't want others to see your tabs? Or just want more space for the websites?
No problem, with this add-on you can hide the tabbar, by just pressing a key.
Pressing the key again, makes everything as it was before.

You can choose a hotkey to do that job or set a time to auto hide the tabbar. It is possible to override existing hotkeys like F1 if you want.

This extension also brings back the feature of hiding the tabbar when only one tab is open, which was removed in Firefox 23.

Please help us translating this add-on into your native language:
http://board.onbroga.de/viewtopic.php?f=62&t=996

addons.name: Always on Top
addons.description: Sets "Always on Top" style for current Firefox window
addons.fullDescription:
Very simple "Always on top" addon implements the same simple functionality - it allows you to add style "Always on top" for current Firefox window.

You can use whether menu item, toolbar item or Ctrl-Alt-T shortcut
addons.developerComments: I have searched for a long time for Firefox addon with this functionality. My search failed. Then I decided to create this very simple but very necessary (at least for me) addon.

addons.name: Hide Caption Titlebar Plus
addons.description:
"Maximize your screen space by adjusting Firefox window TitleBar, borders, Tabs, Toolbars, etc!", with 'smart' options, *optional* custom caption & resizers.  
Multiple Configurable Actions for both screen-corner buttons: Firefox & Close buttons!
addons.fullDescription:
* OUTSTANDING NEWS *

BRAND NEW: Multiple Configurable Actions for both screen-corner buttons!: Custom Firefox and Close buttons

With many new optional actions/features, including for mouse secondary, middle button, wheel, wheel left/right tilt, double-click and Shift key combinations. (with more incoming Ctrl & Alt keys complementary actions)
With Sounds alerts/effects (all configurable), and 3 preset buttons to start with.

New Actions include:     (See screenshots - all details in options dialog)

    Close Tab if no "Page History behind": Close your tabs without missing any previous browsed page. If there is 'something behind' It'll show the 'Page History' popup menu for review.
    I (the author) found this feature among the most useful when having so many tabs opened, including the sound alerting me when the popup appears.
    And there is also "Restore Last Closed Tab" (recommended for mouse secondary button) for easily going back.
    "Close last opened Fx window": close easily those annoying "pop-under" (spam) windows that keeps opening unsolicited (with sound alert when they appear).
    "Zap iframes, Plugins, Images", etc from your pages. (Ie. for ads)
    Stop Image animations
    Recommended for Mouse-wheel: PageUp/Down and for wheel left/right tilt: Select Prev/Next tab: so you can read the content in all your tabs with the mouse only (allowing more confortable positions in those long browsing hours)
    and many more!
     
    With Special Tooltips when mouse-hovering Firefox or Close buttons, showing all configured actions for the button.

    (Other Actions are: FullScreen, Maximize/Restore, quit-Application, "Line Up/Down" , "Page Reload", ...)


Other New options:

    For Fullscreen videos: Smaller (much less intrusive) "[Site] is now fullscreen" msg!
    Stop Image animations! using SHIFT + ESC (like SuperStop addon) 


Other outstanding options are:

    It has the (optional and configurable) "Firefox Application Button" at top-left corner, serving for all those new configurable actions mentioned, and also for the Floating Menu (that appears just by mouse-hovering the button).
    All actions can be done also at the Custom Close button at right corner.
    You can make appear both these corner buttons at Full-Screen also, for never losing actions capability (having them at a tiny size and almost transparent)
    "Smaller Toolbars & buttons"   and   "Smaller Tabs"!
    Since version 2.9.2, this addon is RESTARTLESS(1)
    (1) The restartless addon can be installed, updated, enabled and disabled on the fly. 

Previous News:

    Full compatible with Firefox 29+ (AUSTRALIS Theme). since version 2.8.2 . Fully tested on Windows and Linux!
    Thunderbird version is available! (Windows only)


Other characteristics are:

    The main source of features info is the addon's Options/Preferences dialog, with many tooltips and descriptions. (accessible also from the context-menu mentioned below.)
    There is a Context-Menu (mouse secondary-button-click) accesible from Fx main button, Max,Min&Close buttons and Drag-Window control, for opening Options dialog.
    Compatible with all utility addons that I could test so far. Ie.: Tab Mix Plus, Tab Kit.


General Info:

    Bug/Issue reports are welcomed in the Support site. Please don't post them in a Review here. (Also, please don't report download errors, they are not caused by the addon, but by one of the many download mirrors of this site.)
    Please note that in Mac OSX there are mixed reports about hiding the caption.

    Check the Development Channel at bottom for a possible newer version with last features/fixes! If found, you can check It's Release Notes in "See complete development channel history" link.



Misc. Files:

    'Sound-Pack' file to restore 5 missing sounds in Firefox45+ (listed in sound configuration panel)
        http://tiny.cc/darth_moz goto 'HCTP' > 'hctp_soundpack_1.zip'
    after downloading, copy the soundfiles in your local storage at:
     %HOMEPATH%\Documents\hctp_config\ (same folder/directory used by custom sound files)
    (%HOMEPATH% -> User Home Directory) 


“VERTICAL MAXIMIZE” new feature notes:

    For being able to drag Fx window using tab-bar background, in rare cases It's needed to 'deactivate' Fx (eg. by pressing Windows key) and activate it again.
    (I'm still not sure if this issue is specific to this new feature)


See Developer’s Comments below for Translators tips!, more Technical details and testing tips.
addons.developerComments:
** About Firefox 12 or later issue: Disabled Customizable-Min,Max,Close-buttons ** (in Windows with Glass desktop)
On 2012-01-15 was changed a needed Firefox capability that allows addons like HCTP to have customizable Min,Max,Close Buttons in Windows Glass desktop, that I still hope to be fixed sometime soon.
 Since version 2.7.1 finally there's a workaround for this!.
FYI: In options dialog (where customizable buttons are configured), there's an option to fix this condition (by default, customizable buttons are ON). Also, this problem don't affect you if "Show Firefox 4+ Titlebar" is setted to "enabled" (of course losing some space).

    I've filed Firefox Bug 730219 on 2012-02-24 about this.
    This is discussed already in the Support Site, Issue 178.



Testing tips:
I's recommended (and very easy) to test any issue by opening a new Firefox window with a blank (fresh) profile! (You can leave open the main Firefox window, that wont be affected at all). Very useful to identify addons incompatibilities.

Simply run this command:
  firefox.exe -no-remote -profile "c:\_Firefox_temp_profile"

    Having another Fx window with a fresh profile can also be useful to try at will this and other addons without interfering with your main Fx window/profile. (Just in case, more info here: "Opening New instance of Firefox with another profile" )



Translators tips!:
Translations are very welcomed here: !

    http://beta.babelzilla.org/projects/p/Hide_Caption_Titlebar_Plus/
    We can use Babelzilla forum for any further discussion.
    Thank you!

In Options Dialog, You can get almost all tooltip's texts visible at same time by adding the word "dlgTooltips" to preference entry: "extensions.hide_caption.plus.z_sys.intFlags".
(Useful to review translated texts. Dialog can get pretty unresponsive at times and It will look like messed up, It's better to maximize it!)
  The "id" value (with yellow bkg, showed for reference) at top of each tooltip is roughly equivalent to the corresponding DTD ENTITY ID.
  Tips without "id" (cyan bkg) are the content of "tooltiptext" attributes (the ones that cannot include <tag>s)
And for even messier look :-), and showing all popup-menus content at once: add also the word "dlgPopups" to that same preference.
At bottom it shows a new MenuList for seeing Popup-Notifications messages contained in main.properties file.
*New!:* you can show _only_ this, using new (3rd) word: "dlgNotifs" (since version 3.1.1)
(Also, most label-texts can be selected for copying with any of these '3 words')

addons.name: HideScrollbars
addons.description: "Hide Scrollbars" add-on removes scrollbars for those who prefer mouse wheel and keyboard navigation.
addons.fullDescription:
This add-on will stop working when Firefox 57 arrives in November 2017 and Mozilla drops support for XUL / XPCOM / legacy add-ons. It should still work on Firefox 52 ESR until ESR moves to Firefox 59 ESR in 2018 (~Q2).

There is no "please port it" or "please add support for it" this time, because the entire add-on eco system changes and the technology behind this kind of add-on gets dropped without replacement.

---------------------------------------------------------------


This small add-on removes scrollbars for those who prefer mouse wheel and keyboard navigation.

Note: After first installation all already opened tabs have to be reloaded once.

NewScrollbars add-on offers even more ways to modify and customize scrollbars.
